description: This course traces the path of invertebrate evolution from single-celled protozoans to
the most primitive chordates. Emphasis is placed upon major breakthroughs in design that
enable organisms to exploit new ecological habitats. Laboratories are designed to
introduce students to the major invertebrate groups via observation of living animals and
through dissection.  Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week.
Counts as "comparative organismal biology" core category. Also counts
